description: From mar +‎ plot. In earliest use as a character name in The Busy Body,[1] by Susanna Centlivre.

adjectives.description: marplot (comparative more marplot, superlative most marplot)

entries.meaning: (now rare) That foils a plot; interfering. [from 18th c.]
examples: Let us argue the point with this pert, unruly, marplot conscience of mine…

entries.meaning: A meddlesome person whose activity interferes with the plans of others. [from 18th c.]
examples: “The old marplot has discovered the baby,” Monica whispered. “I suppose it cried and woke him up, and now he thinks he's witness to a miracle.”
